intro: Dumerilia auriculata, commonly known as the ear-shaped dumerelia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa, and thrives in sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its distinctive ear-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in coastal and sandy environments, where it adapts well to saline conditions. The plant's unique morphology and ecological niche make it a notable species in its native habitat.
